qas.question: What year was the Polaris Missile Facility Atlantic station closed?
How many nuclear warheads were stored at the Polaris Missile Facility Atlantic station?
How many SSBN "Boomer" squadrons were homeported at the Weapons Station?
Submarine Squadron 4 is homeported at what type of military base?
What type of security force guards the 2500 nuclear warheads?

answers.text: a U.S. Marine Corps security force company.

qas.question: What year was the Polaris Missile Facility Atlantic station opened?

plausible_answers.text: a U.S. Marine Corps security force company

qas.question: What type of security force guards the 2600 nuclear warheads?

context: During this period, the Weapons Station was the Atlantic Fleet's loadout base for all nuclear ballistic missile submarines. <a2_0><b7_0>Two<b7_0/><a2_0/> SSBN "Boomer" squadrons and a submarine tender were homeported at the Weapons Station, while one SSN attack squadron, Submarine Squadron 4, and a submarine tender were homeported at the <a3_0><b8_0>Naval Base<b8_0/><a3_0/>. At the <a0_0><b5_0>1996<b5_0/><a0_0/> closure of the station's Polaris Missile Facility Atlantic (POMFLANT), over <a1_0><b6_0>2,500<b6_0/> nuclear warheads<a1_0/> and their UGM-27 Polaris, UGM-73 Poseidon, and UGM-96 Trident I delivery missiles (SLBM) were stored and maintained, guarded by <a4_0><b9_0>a U.S. Marine Corps security force company<b9_0/>.
